description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development Programme Component Results (PCR) 3: Adolescent participation and empowerment

participating-org.narrative: DIRECTOR STATE INSTITUTE OF HEALTH AND FAMILY WELFARE
STATE CHILD LABOUR REHABILITATION- CUM-WELFARE SOCIETY

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response
Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

title.narrative: UNICEF India Humanitarian Action for Children Appeal (HAC)
UNICEF Programmes in India (Adolescent Development and Participation)
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework

India 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygieneespecially for the most deprived communities

description.narrative: Mother's Absolute Affection (MAA), the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's national breastfeeding programme, progressively rolled out in over 500 districts across the states with dedicated budgets in the annual health plans to help address undernutrition in infants and young children, especially in the most deprived communities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2018

title.narrative: Proportion of states with a comprehensive communication strategy to support families and communities

Proportion of states with a critical mass of local governance bodies, civil society organizations and community resource persons with necessary knowledge and skills to stimulate demand for essential nutrition services and adoption of essential nutrition practices to prevent undernutrition in infants and young children in the most deprived communities

actual.value: 2018:15 states on track with interventions giving priority to districts/blocks with predominantly tribal population.

title.narrative: Proportion of states where a broad-based partnership with local governance bodies and civil society organizations to support families and communities' demand for essential nutrition practices to prevent undernutrition in infants, young children and their mothers

actual.value: 2018:15/16 states on track and have forged partnerships with non-governmental organizations, academic institutions, professional bodies, religious groups and media to raise awareness and demand for Maternal, Infant and Young Child Nutrition-related services.
